column1: What do you think the people of the team do well, and should keep doing?
column2: What do you think the people of the team could do better?

column4: What do you think Claudio does could do better?

column6: What do you think Richel could do better?

column8: What do you think Theo could do better?

column19: Do you think we should start on a new game after the Summer holiday?

column1: Help each other and do not prioritize making progress over helping
column2: Focus on merging to keep project cohesion
column5: He is there to help and structure the work, he is very good at teaching
column6: Do not talk about programming during the breaks
column7: He has ideas and he pursues them
column10: Perhaps vote on task force so that we can focus energy on few at a time
column14: Perhaps doing some live programming with a minimal example (also easy to understand by newbies)
column15: I like to keep in touch with part of the project that I do not work on
column16: There should be some minimal preparation so that it can truly benefit team members
column18: Have some kind of roadmap and focus/priority
column19: No, I would like to continue working on this game
column21: Can do it at my own time
column22: preferred to do it face to face, one person at a time, less anonymous

column1: It's always a pleasure to work with everyone in the team!
column2: It would be good practice to make sure your branch is ready to work on (no uncommitted stuff, unresolved merged conflict etx.) before joining the session. We sometimes lose a lot of time to these issues instead of programming.
column11: I love that we can interrupt to ask questions, and I feel the frequency of the sessions is ideal.
column12: Ask members to provide Richel with ideas of issues / topics to work on a bit ahead (1 hour before?) of the session? Ofc Richel should always be free to decide what he will work on :)
column14: Maybe we could keep track of the guidelines that were discussed in the past somewhere in a .md or a Discord channel? with links to the corresponding sections in the book.
column18: Maybe it would be time to settle on a name for the game? Also, we should start a pyramid scheme to get more people in the team %)
column19: No, I would like to continue working on this game
column21: I enjoy that it's (only?) as long to fill as we want it to be, and that there is room to answer extra questions or not answer some of them

column1: Yes, they are all kind and patient.
column2: I know the better way to master something is to start doing it, but I do think some clear and basic guides matter.
column3: I think he is really nice.
column5: He likes encouraging people, I really like it.
column9: Stick to the time, that's perfect.
column11: I don't know what is the monthly mob programming sessions, I can't tell.
column13: Is it the 5 minutes by Richel before we start working. If it is, then I think it's too short.
column14: I think the time for it can be prolonged.
column15: Don't know what the monthly project update is.
column19: No, I would like to continue working on this game
column21: Asking what can be improved. I don't have any complaints about it, but it's good to see that the group is always preparing to be improved. :)
